page.title: 10THE HOME PARK WINDSOR
page.content: by Heidi,Steven,Gareth,Michael {HOME PARK PUBLIC * }This is a public open space between King Edward VII Avenue and the river Thames: {HOME PARK PRIVATE *}This is 720 acres of land near Windsor Castle owned by the Crown,not open to the public.It consists of Prince Consort Farm and Royal Dairy designed by Prince Albert, with a pig herd and a Jersey herd;Shaw Farm has an Ayrshire herd;Royal Gardens with glasshouses producing flowers for royal residences;there is a mushroom unit there;cricket,bowls and golf clubs;Frogmore Gardens with Queen Victoria's mother's house, Frogmore House,the Royal Mausoleum where Prince Albert and Queen Victoria are buried,the Duchess of Kent's Mausoleum and Royal Burial Ground for members who are not sovereigns. Staff cottages are dotted around the area.
